11.19.20  2:50 pm   Recently you've said that you only know what works best the FIRST time you hear it,

      but what happens when you know what you are going to need before you start? Is there a naive mode of thinking to trick your brain into finding flangers and phasers as interesting as when you first used them? Or is that something which you need before their practice and use can be picked up easily?
11.19.20  2:34 pm   If you remake "history of the entire world, i guess," what would you add?

11.19.20  2:09 pm   Have you ever thought about how infinite infinity is?

      (rant incoming!) I mean, let's use the theory that there is an infinite amount of universes. For every change at any place at any time, there's a universe for that. But not only that, there's an INFINITE amount of universes where that change happened but slightly different. Also, if there truly is an infinite amount of universes, anything that can happen WILL happen. And again, it has happened, is happening, and will happen an infinite amount of times. I think that's pretty cool.
11.19.20  2:02 pm   In which way (if any) do you think the crazy state the world is currently in affects you and your artistic production?

11.19.20  10:45 am   do you have tips for getting good at improvising on the piano, more specifically than just doing it a lot for a long time? my practice usually goes like this: i play a note with my right hand, invent melody from there, and try to play accompanying chords with my left hand, slowly enough to not be *completely* riddled with mistakes but fast enough to still sound like music a little. i do that for like 30 minutes a day (is that long enough if i want to get good before i'm dead?). sometimes i instead start with a note with the left hand, invent a bassline from there and play chords with the right hand. and some other times i play a bassline with a melody, mostly without chords but sometimes try to slide one in when i feel adventurous. (i would sing too but i live in circumstances that makes it feel like a bad idea at the moment.) do you have better strategies? thanks if you read all that, even if you don't answer
